content.title: A Political & Military Alliance
content.text: NATO's essential purpose is to safeguard the freedom and security of all its members by political and military means.

content.title: Collective Defence (Article 5)
content.text: NATO is committed to the principle that an attack against one or more of its members is considered an attack against all. This is the core of the Alliance.

content.title: Crisis Management
content.text: NATO has the military capabilities and political will to help manage crises affecting Alliance security, both within and beyond its borders.

content.title: Cooperative Security
content.text: NATO works with partner countries and international organisations to promote security, tackle shared challenges, and build stability.

content.title: Political Consultation
content.text: The North Atlantic Council (NAC) is the principal political decision-making body, where Allies discuss issues and make decisions by consensus.

content.title: Military Structure
content.text: NATO has an integrated military command structure, advised by the Military Committee, to implement political decisions with military implications.
